intro: Canthium sclerocarpum, commonly known as the hard-seeded spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains hard, dry seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Canthium sclerocarpum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
